content: a half squares which you can either position at the top so that the sleeve will have a square down the outside or at the bottom so the joins all line up with the front and back panels below the sleeves the front and back panels are seamed together join the front and back panels at the shoulders starting from the sleeve and working the number of squares calculated in step 3 this may finish half way along a square which is fine this was my cardigan before i attached the hood attach the hood to the remaining squares of the front and back panels the hood width should exactly match the remaining squares then holding the two front edges of the hood together join along the top from front to back until you run out of stitches finally add the pockets where desired note that unlike all the previous joins the stitches may not line up nicely which is fine page 9 recipe for a granny square cardigan by insertinnergeek designs step 8 add the cuffs start with a slip knot for the working loop join the yarn to the underside of the sleeve with a slip_stitch and chain 10 stitches holding the chain out in line with the sleeve the cuff is worked back and forth joining to the sleeve with a slip_stitch at the end of each right side row the right side will form the outside of the cuff and the wrong side will be the inside of the cuff after the tenth chain chain 1 as a turning chain you will now be working back towards the sleeve starting in the chain second from the hook single us double uk crochet single_crochet in each chain 10 stitches slip_stitch into the sleeve in the second stitch along from where the chain was joined turn the work and single_crochet into the back loop only scblo of each of the single crochets from the row below 10 single crochets repeat the following two row until the cuff goes all the way around the sleeve finishing with a right side row right side row chain 1 turning chain scblo 10 slip_stitch into second sleeve stitch from the previous row wrong side row scblo 10 join the two ends of the cuff together with single crochets the same technique as joining two squares and secure the end repeat for the other sleeve page 10 recipe for a granny square cardigan by insertinnergeek designs step 9 add the border/button band start with a slip knot for the working loop join the yarn to the centre of the bottom hem with a slip_stitch and chain 7 stitches holding the chain out from the hem the border is worked back and forth joining to the hem with a slip_stitch at the end of each right side row the right side will form the outside of the border and the wrong side will be the inside of the border after the seventh chain chain
